intro: Mitrasacme subvolubilis, commonly known as the creeping mitrasacme, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, pale yellow flowers. Its stems are flexible and often trail along the ground, forming dense mats. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and marshy areas.
